intro: Collomia linearis f. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf flaxflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which is known for its showy flowers and often hairy stems. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
